title: Hayward Universal H-Series Digital (HFDN) — Symptom Lookup

symptoms.symptom: Heater display is blank or will not power on
actions: Verify 120/240V power at terminal block
Check transformer output (24–28 VAC)
Replace fuse or control board if no response

causes: Blower vacuum switch not responding correctly
actions: Check blower operation and hose connection
Measure continuity across vacuum switch during blower run
Replace vacuum switch if contacts do not open/close correctly

symptoms.symptom: Displays IF or heater fails to ignite
causes: Defective igniter or improper flame signal
No gas supply or low pressure
actions: Check 120V to igniter during ignition sequence
Verify flame rectification current ≥ 1.5 µA DC
Clean flame sensor and confirm gas valve operation

symptoms.symptom: Displays HS or heater shuts off on high limit
causes: High-limit sensor open due to overheating
actions: Check filter, bypass, and plumbing for flow restriction
Verify high-limit continuity below 135°F
Replace faulty limit sensor

causes: Low water flow or pressure switch open
actions: Ensure circulation pump is running and primed
Check and clean filter
Replace pressure switch if it does not close under normal flow
Verify correct line polarity
Confirm ground continuity
Measure 110–130 VAC supply

causes: Communication failure between display and main board
actions: Inspect ribbon cable and connectors
Clean corrosion and reseat plug
Replace display if communication error persists

symptoms.symptom: Displays HF or flame detected when off
causes: Gas valve leaking or stuck open
actions: Check flame sense wire for short to ground
Verify gas valve operation and replace if necessary
Inspect control board for relay fault

symptoms.symptom: Displays SF or temperature reading error
causes: Thermistor open or out of calibration
actions: Check resistance of inlet/outlet sensors (77°F ≈ 10 kΩ)
Replace bad sensor and retest operation

symptoms.symptom: No code displayed but heater will not fire
causes: System flow or thermostat setpoint issue
actions: Verify proper flow and temperature setpoint
Check safety circuit wiring and fuses
